Sportradar is the most well known one and it is the one used by many of the reputable crypto casinos if I am mistaken as this topic has come up even other times.The problem is not which provider provides the odds to the bookies as all of them lay the odds in the favor of the casino,for example when a team should have high chances to win and the real odd should be like 1.30,they intentionally may make that odd go up to scare us at 1.45-1.60,the same can be said for a certain team which is not a heavy favorite and the odd should be 1.8-1.9 for them and the bookies give them 1.60 as odd so you go and place your bet thinking you will win,a clear example of this was the Milsami game in Europa Conference League yesterday,ended 2-2 but the home team which was not a heavy favorite had an odd of 1.45 when in reality it should had 1.7-1.8.What do I want to say with all of this?I want to say it is not important who provide the odds but how good we as bettors can read them.

comments.body: Quote from: mumu68 on July 16, 2023, 04:43:38 PMWhat are some cheap providers to become a bookmaker without a license?Regardless of the purpose, as far as I know (and anyone can correct me with this), being a licensed bookmaker is one of the main requirements for getting Sports Odds Providers service. In other words, the site will be subject first to checking before granting the service.Out of curiosity, do you plan on building a sports betting site? Even if there's a cheap provider available or maybe close to being free (I believed there are), I doubt you can lure bettors on testing your site. It's obvious that in building a betting site, you will really need to spend decent capital to start with. If you can't afford to spend on the "priority" things that a sports betting site should have, then it means you are not ready yet.
